website_summaries.verdict: This mummy-style bag is the perfect choice if you camp in damp climates. Its natural down filling is treated to make it more resistant to water, a quality many down sleeping bags lack.
pros: Seams wrap to provide maximum warmth
Pockets keep your personal items accessible
cons: The 20°F rating may be a little generous

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This must be a great piece be cause someone broke into my car and took it away from me.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaoyuan Lyu

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight perfect for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Avid thru-hiker here. This helps lighten the load and keeps you plenty warm in the late fall. I haven’t tested it in serious cold weather but it is down. I recommend you use a plastic liner in your backpack and wrap it up good. You don’t want this one wet. Great bag.
customer_reviews.author: James Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6ft - Fits snug and cozily.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easily packable. I used this @ Reds and Agnew Meadows and in the Sierra. It works pretty well and I don't have any additional notes about it. Would buy again for the sale price.
customer_reviews.author: Breakfast Burrito Lover 724

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sleeping bag that I have ever purchased. Well made, so soft and comfy and amazingly warm. I look forward to testing it in cold weather and seeing how it performs. So far, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: melissa f

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The product is very light weight and easy to pack. It has been very comfortable for all of my camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value down sleeping bag. I got three of them for my sons for Christmas and they love them.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me in Joshua Tree National Park in October
customer_reviews.text: I've had Marmot bags before. This one is nice and light and perfect for backpacking. It also comes with a larger packing bag so when you store it at home, it doesn't need to be stuffed into the compact sac. They say this is better for the longevity of the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Proceviat

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a gift for his elk/hiking trip to Colorado and he absolutely loved it. Said it was perfect, packable, light and warm!
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon Kaltenbach

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Just got back and used this bag out for a trip in the White Mountains in NH. With a hammock, underquilt and this bag, I was fine with temps well down into the lower 30’s and upper 20’s. The bag worked exactly as advertised. The zipper is one of the best I’ve used as far as functionality goes. Top notch material and not too heavy. I’m 6’5” 235lbs and the long version was a good fit for me. The compression sack it comes with could be better but that’s my only negative critique. If you’re over analyzing and want a quality bag- pull the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Doucette

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought another! Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one during Amazon day, when it was a great price. I was attracted to the size and weight for my 11 year old son who is in Scouts and backpacking. Wish I bought another because it's so nice! Keeping my eye on this one in case the price drops again!
customer_reviews.author: Caniac Nation

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: This bag will not be for everyone, but for my 5'10" tall husband who weighs about 160 pounds, it is "perfect." The drawstring to close the area around the face, the zipper pocket for glasses, a phone, or a small flashlight is nice. He assures me that you will NOT roll over and break any of these as you are "mummified." The stuff sack is about 12" long with an 8" diameter, and this huge bag fits into it. It also comes with a bigger bag for "usual" storage that is as big as most laundry bags. Warm & well designed. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne R. Arnholt

customer_reviews.title: Marmot makes the best stuff
customer_reviews.text: Marmot might be my favorite brand ( for anything). I love my Marmot puffy jacket and my Marmot down vest and my Marmot leather gloves. I look forward to winter just so I can use my Marmot stuff. Now that I have this wonderful Marmot sleeping bag I can’t wait to go camping. Marmot makes the best stuff and this bag does not disappoint. Super high quality. I am attaching a photo of the label on the bag which seems to imply that men and women will have different minimum comfort levels with respect to ambient temperature. Fascinating stuff. I wonder how they measure that exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: I love Marmot gear. It's no-nonsense and forgoes an emphasis on features to focus on the highest quality materials. This sleeping bag is no exception. Everything from the zipper to the fill is exceptional. As for comfort, I'm 5'10' and this bag cradled me like a glove. The filling provides the right amount of loft for cushion and warmth. I love the simple pocket for phone and/or flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: It's warm. It's comfortable. It's durable. Easy to carry. Holds a six foot tall man well. Snug. Water proof. Rolls up RIDICULOUSLY easy. Can't recommend enough. Rolls up so small.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Nice Midweight Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag with excellent weight to warmth ratio. Handy storage pocket and packs small for saving weight on a backpacking trip. Also includes a larger storage bag to prevent compression during long term storage. Good value for the price in a down bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Fegler

product_meta.title: Marmot Ironwood 20 Mummy Lightweight Sleeping Bag, 20-Degree Rating, Denim/Steel Onyx
product_meta.description: An all around down bag for damp weather, the water resistant 650 fill power down ironwood 20 has all the functional appointments of a sleeping bag built to generate a comfortable night out, even when you can't see the stars.
feature_bullets: Mummy style 20 degree sleeping bag for backpacking, camping, and other outdoor activities; certified 650 fill power down with Down Defender improves water resistance in wet conditions
EN rated as comfortable for men at a lower limit of approximately 20 degrees Fahrenheit
Ground level side seams wrap around body for maximum warmth; stretch tricot baffles keep insulation in place, limiting cold spots
Anatomically shaped footbox for more wiggle room and less heat buildup; nautilus multi baffle hood design limits heat loss from your head
Internal stash pocket keeps small gear accessible; included stuff sack makes it easy to stay organized when setting up camp or packing up to head home

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
